text: Nice trick and awesome way to test responsive design concepts <https://twitter.com/352inc/status/568790170272702464/photo/1>

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/352inc|@352inc>: Want responsive images in <https://twitter.com/sketchapp|@sketchapp>? Set your image as a background Pattern Fill (set to Fill) and boom. #webdesign <https://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/B-S_pTrIIAAkKQ6.png>
attachments.text: Want responsive images in <https://twitter.com/sketchapp|@sketchapp>? Set your image as a background Pattern Fill (set to Fill) and boom. #webdesign <https://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/B-S_pTrIIAAkKQ6.png>

text: <!channel> Just a quick reminder this event is happening this week. I'll join the hangout so if you're interested in watching it we can grab a meeting room. <http://alistapart.com/events>
Anyone know if Galapagos accepts GIFs in blog post entries? I've had no success with it yet and am wondering if it's Galapagos or the internet connection.
On the phone so I can't check. But what seems to be the problem?

It just indefinitely stays in Uploading mode. I tried a png and it did the same, but then I tried a jpg and it worked fine. Do you know of any limitations as far as file type and file size for image uploads?
I don't think so. How big is the gif?
I don't think that's the problem but it's a little too big.
I'm almost home. Can you send me the file and I'll try a couple of things when I get there?
I can send it but it's mostly a test to see what I can put up on a blog post.
